title: The death of fiscal conservatism: are economies loosening the purse strings just at the wrong time?
text:
Memories of painful bailouts and debt crises pushing countries to the brink appear to be fading fast just a decade after the global economy was brought to its knees.

After years of belt-tightening, Boris Johnson has discovered a magic money tree – and just in the nick of time ahead of a probable snap election.

Last Tuesday, the Institute for Fiscal Studies’ Green Budget found the Conservatives have committed to boost day-to-day spending to levels close to those promised by Jeremy Corbyn in Labour’s 2017 manifesto.

Voters could be forgiven for being confused at the huge shift in tone on public spending and debt, and by a Conservative prime minister no less. In the wake of the financial crisis,...
description: Memories of painful bailouts and debt crises pushing countries to the brink appear to be fading fast just a decade after the global economy was brought to its knees.
